intro: Corydalis lhasaensis, commonly known as the Lhasa Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in early spring. Corydalis lhasaensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
